text:
Name: Historic City of Sucre. short_description:

Sucre, the first capital of Bolivia, was founded by the Spanish in the first half of the 16th century. Its many well-preserved 16th-century religious buildings, such as San LÃ¡zaro, San Francisco and Santo Domingo, illustrate the blending of local architectural traditions with styles imported from Europe.
